question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Enum: ModuleRead] [Cache type confusion] Can switching between GlobalCache and PerBlockCache reads for the same module create validation bypasses where overridden global modules are not detected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Struct: CapturedReads] [Data reads HashMap collision] Can hash collisions in the data_reads HashMap be exploited to overwrite or conflate reads from different keys, leading to incorrect validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Struct: CapturedReads] [Group reads inconsistency] Can an attacker create inconsistent states by manipulating both data_reads and group_reads for the same key, bypassing validation checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Struct: CapturedReads] [Delayed field reads race] Can concurrent modifications to delayed_field_reads HashMap create race conditions where reads are validated against incorrect delayed field states? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Struct: CapturedReads] [Aggregator v1 tracking bypass] Can an attacker bypass aggregator_v1_reads tracking by reading aggregator state through non-standard interfaces, avoiding proper validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Struct: CapturedReads] [Module reads HashMap collision] Can hash collisions in module_reads hashbrown::HashMap be exploited to cause validation failures or incorrect module versioning? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Field: delayed_field_speculative_failure] [Failure flag manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the delayed_field_speculative_failure flag to prevent proper validation of delayed field reads at commit time? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Field: non_delayed_field_speculative_failure] [Failure flag bypass] Can setting non_delayed_field_speculative_failure to false after detecting inconsistencies allow invalid transactions to commit? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Field: incorrect_use] [Invariant violation bypass] Can the incorrect_use flag be bypassed or reset to allow transactions that violate CapturedReads usage invariants to execute successfully? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Field: data_read_comparator] [Comparator state manipulation] Can the DataReadComparator's blockstm_v2_incarnation field be manipulated to switch between v1 and v2 validation modes mid-execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::new()] [Initialization race condition] Can concurrent calls to new() with different blockstm_v2_incarnation values create inconsistent CapturedReads instances that validate differently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::default()] [Default initialization vulnerability] Does the default() implementation with None incarnation create security risks when used in BlockSTM v2 contexts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Enum: UpdateResult] [IncorrectUse error suppression] Can IncorrectUse results be suppressed or ignored to allow invalid read captures to persist in the read set? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Enum: UpdateResult] [Inconsistency detection bypass] Can the Inconsistency result be bypassed by ensuring that inconsistent reads never trigger the compare_data_reads check? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::update_entry()] [Entry update race condition] Can concurrent calls to update_entry() for the same key create race conditions where inconsistent reads are both inserted, bypassing validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::update_entry()] [Metadata size merge exploitation] Can the merge_metadata_and_size() fast path be exploited to bypass kind comparison checks and insert inconsistent data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::update_entry()] [Same kind incorrect use] When read and existing_read have the same kind, can an attacker exploit the early return to avoid proper validation checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::update_entry()] [Vacant entry exploitation] Can an attacker flood the system with Vacant entries that always return UpdateResult::Inserted, bypassing validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::update_entry()] [Occupied entry mutation] Can mutations to occupied entries through get_mut() create inconsistent states visible to concurrent readers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::capture_group_size()] [Group size inconsistency] Can an attacker capture different group sizes for the same key across multiple capture attempts, and does the comparison properly detect all inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::capture_group_size()] [Size overflow attack] Can extremely large ResourceGroupSize values cause integer overflow when compared or used in gas calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::group_size()] [None size exploitation] When group.collected_size is None, can this be exploited to bypass gas charging for resource group operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::capture_group_read()] [Target kind conversion failure] Can an attacker force convert_to(target_kind) to fail by providing incompatible DataRead variants, triggering incorrect_use flag and causing sequential execution fallback? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::capture_group_read()] [Error type confusion] Can the conversion between PanicError and PartialVMError create vulnerabilities where critical errors are downgraded to speculative execution aborts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/captured_reads.rs] [Function: CapturedReads::capture_group_read()] [Group key tag collision] Can hash collisions between (group_key, tag) pairs cause reads to different resources to be treated as the same? (High)
